intro: Cnemidaria munita, commonly known as the common thornapple, is a flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant produces round, fleshy fruits that are often covered in a waxy coating. It is native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Cnemidaria munita is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and disturbed sites.
